feedback.correct: Correct, LLM explicitly stands for this phrase.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, LLM stands for Large Language Models.

questions.text: T/F: LLMs can distinguish facts from fiction.

feedback.correct: Correct, they can produce confident but incorrect statements.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, LLMs may struggle with fact-checking.

questions.text: How are the capabilities of a neural network restricted?
options: The quality of the training data.
The quality of the training data and amount of training data.

feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, data quality and quantity both matter.

questions.text: T/F: LLMs can generate code with security vulnerabilities.

feedback.correct: Correct, generated code can contain flaws.

questions.text: T/F: We currently have artificial general intelligence.

feedback.correct: Correct, we only have narrower AI.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, AGI does not yet exist.

questions.text: T/F: We currently have artificial narrow intelligence.

feedback.correct: Correct, present AI is specialized for specific tasks.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, narrow AI does exist today.

questions.text: T/F: Neural Networks can adapt and accurately fulfill requests outside of its training data.

feedback.correct: Correct, they cannot reliably handle completely novel tasks without errors.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, they rely heavily on their training data.

questions.text: What may be an example of bias in a neural network's training data?
options: Only hiring male candidates because those were the successful candidates in the training data.
Higher false positive matching for faces of racial minorities.
An image sorting algorithm assuming a banana is a bus.

feedback.correct: Correct, all are examples of bias.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, this is not the only example of bias.

questions.text: Whose responsibility is it to ensure that code provided by LLMs is safe when it is incorporated into company software?

feedback.correct: Correct, it's up to developers to vet the code.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, developers must take responsibility for AI-generated code.

questions.text: What everyday software does LLMs resemble most?

feedback.correct: Correct, they suggest text or responses based on learned patterns.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, LLMs most closely resemble predictive text systems.

questions.text: Should you use LLMs as a search engine?

feedback.correct: Correct, they are not designed to reliably replace search engines.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, they can be inaccurate or outdated.
